Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the central government has taken custody of all mosques in Kashmir, which is not true.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the central government has taken custody of mosques in Kashmir.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the recovery of a large stash of arms from mosques in Kashmir is the reason behind the government taking custody of the mosques, without providing any concrete evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there has been no development of the central government taking custody of mosques in Kashmir.
Exist alternative explanation: The photographs shared with the claim are found to be old and unrelated to the situation in Kashmir, indicating that there could be alternative explanations for the recovered arms and the custody of mosques.
